name: Ritaja.GitHub.io
body:
#ritaja sengupta
- Munich, Germany
- 4917631575046
- ritaja.sengupta@gmail.com


Actively looking for full time opportunities in analytics/machine learning/data engineering/data mining/fraud analytics. As a Masters student in machine learning and applying concepts in the industry as part of the Masters thesis, over a duration of 9 months, I am inclined to work in this field.

---
## Technical Skills
**Like:** java, python, machine-learning, jenkins, puppet, vagrant, selenium, protocol-buffers, maven, theano, keras, lasagne, apache-spark, hadoop, bigdata, mongodb, scala, r, rest

---
##Experience

**Working Student**, optile, *March 2015 – Current*

python, theano, keras, lasagne, r, java, mongodb, apache-spark

- Development of a Risk Analysis system to score transactions based on machine learning models. A special attention to deep learning and optimisation is devoted during the course of the project.
(Information withheld complying with confidentiality.)

---

**Working Student**, optile, *June 2014 – Current*

java, mongodb, rest, vagrant, puppet, maven, git, jenkins, jira, rest-assured, selenium, gradle

- Development of Automation framework to test Payment processes.
- Development of Automation test framework  for OPTILE`s RESTful services.
- Development of Automation test framework for MongoDb, Neo4j data storage of transactions.
- Development of Automation test framework for internal state machines.
- Automation using vagrant, puppet

technologies actively used:
- JAVA
- Maven
- MONGODB
- VAGRANT
- PUPPET

---

**Workstudent**, Implen, *February 2014 – May 2014*

java, selenium, gradle

- Software Architecture Design
- Web driver for automation testing using Selenium for Java
- Apache POI library integration
- Zephyr for JIRA
- SOAP UI for RESTful webservices

---

**System Engineer**, Infosys, *July 2012 – September 2013*

c++, cmake

Providing IT solutions to a German Energy major and automating sub-processes in the domain.

---

**Intern**, Infosys, *January 2012 – May 2012*

python, pygame

Paint Tool using Python programming with basic image editing capabilities.

---

**Intern**, Cognizant, *June 2011 – July 2011*


Studying, documenting the process followed at the department to develop deliverable for the client and also to suggest improvements to increase the overall efficiency of the process.

---

Associated with the literary society at SIT, under CAC.
Member of the computer science and IT forum at SIT.
